sen.j: 征討大将軍(せいとうたいしょうぐん)とは、戊辰戦争において新政府が設置した臨時軍政官のこと。
sen.e: Seito taishogun was a military official temporarily set up by the new government during the Boshin Civil War.

sen.j: 明治元年(1868年)正月4日、新政府は仁和寺宮嘉彰法親王(後の小松宮彰仁親王)を征討大将軍に補して、錦旗・節刀を授けられ東寺に陣を敷き、次いで大阪に進み、京阪地域の軍事を指揮した。
sen.e: On January 4th in the first year of the Meiji period (1868), Ninnajinomiya Yoshiakira Hosshinno (later, Imperial Prince Komatsunomiya Akihito) was accepted as Seto taishogun and given the banner and a sword from the emperor by the new government, and took up a position at the Toji Temple, then proceeded to Osaka where he directed military affairs in the Keihan area.

sen.j: また、対外的には外国事務総裁を兼ねて外交交渉をも担当した。
sen.e: In addition, in foreign affairs, he was responsible for diplomatic negotiations as Gaikoku Jimu Sosai (official in charge of foreign affairs).

sen.j: 同月28日に凱旋、帰京すると仁和寺宮は任務を解かれ征討大将軍は廃官となった。
sen.e: In the same month, after he returned to Kyoto in glory, Ninnajinomiya was acquitted of his duty as seito taishogun, which was abolished.

sen.j: 新政府軍が江戸進軍を開始した折には、征討大将軍は東征大総督に委任されることとなった。
sen.e: When the new government forces began penetrating Edo, the seito taishogun was made Tosho Daishotoku (military commander for the Eastern provinces).
